title: Particle Motion - position relative to an axis

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 8"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals ln open parentheses t squared plus 1 close parentheses plus sin t minus 2.2"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2.2</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals t cubed minus 9 t plus e to the power of t minus 2"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, which of the following describes the position of the particle with respect to the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis?

choices.label: The particle is to the left of the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis on the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 1.524"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1.524</mn></math> only.

The particle is to the left of the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis on the intervals <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 1.524"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1.524</mn></math> and <math alttext="3.584 less or equal than t less or equal than 4.833"><mn>3.584</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4.833</mn></math>.

The particle is to the left of the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis on the interval <math alttext="2.332 less or equal than t less or equal than 8"><mn>2.332</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></math>.

The particle is to the left of the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis on the interval <math alttext="4.833 less or equal than t less or equal than 8"><mn>4.833</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></math> only.

content.answer: The particle is to the left of the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis on the intervals <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 1.524"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1.524</mn></math> and <math alttext="3.584 less or equal than t less or equal than 4.833"><mn>3.584</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4.833</mn></math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
